title: Drawing, Design for Stained Glass Windows: Chamber Music Hall, Carnegie Hall, New York, NY, late 19th century
title_raw: Design for Stained Glass Windows: Chamber Music Hall, Carnegie Hall, New York, NY
medium: Brush and wash, gouache, graphite on paper mounted on tan illustration board
inscribed:
recto, in graphite: Chamber Music Hall / (2 of These)

verso: writing in pen and black obscured by remains of a paper label. Label is stamped in pinkish-red ink: W. L. Colwell, then crossed out repeatedly with graphite.  

Below, in pen and black ink: no. 52
description: Rectangular glass window in yellow and blue; at center four petals; above, lunette in multicolored glasses with blue and pink.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Design for Stained Glass Windows: Chamber Music Hall, Carnegie Hall, New York, NY, late 19th century. Brush and wash, gouache, graphite on paper mounted on tan illustration board. 
Gift of Alice C. Morse. 2009-6-3-a,b
